means: 使（液体）的温度维持在沸点或稍低于沸点的温度

sentence.Network_en: To reconstitute dried tomatoes, simmer in plain water until they are tender.
sentence.Network_cn: 要泡开西红柿干，需要将其放在清水中用文火炖，直到它们变软。

sentence.Network_en: Simmer the sauce gently for 10 minutes.
sentence.Network_cn: 把调味汁用文火炖10分钟。

jx.jx_en_mean: To become calm after excitement or anger.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 冷静下来：在激动或愤怒后变得平静

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: alteration of dialect simper (in the same sense), perhaps imitative

entry.def: When you simmer food or when it simmers, you cook it by keeping it at boiling point or just below boiling point.

example.ex: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together...
example.tran: 将大黄和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火炖,熬成汤药。

example.ex: Turn the heat down so the sauce simmers gently.
example.tran: 将炉火调小，用文火炖调味汁。

entry.def: If a conflict or a quarrel simmers, it does not actually happen for a period of time, but eventually builds up to the point where it does.

example.ex: ...bitter divisions that have simmered for more than half a century...
example.tran: 酝酿了半个多世纪的严重分歧

example.ex: The gardener exploded with the rage that had simmered all morning...
example.tran: 花匠憋了一个早上的愤怒终于爆发了。

means.word_mean: 1. temperature just below the boiling point;

sentences.sentence: "the stew remained at a simmer for hours"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bring to the boil then reduce to a simmer.

auth_sentence.res_content: Simmer, covered, for a further two minutes.

auth_sentence.content: Bring to a simmer and cook for five minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bring to a simmer and cook for five minutes.

Sentence.sentence: Simmering (难以平息的) resentment is seldom an aid to education.

sentences.en: Bring the potatoes to a simmer.
The soup was left to simmer.

jushi.english: Simmer is a kind of cooking method.
The soup was left to simmer.
The meat has been simmered for one hour.
